perturbation.original_text: The Parties agree to meet via conference call within five (5) business days of the end of  each month to determine the necessary adjustment, if any, to the Deposit. If it is determined that the Deposit must be  increased, within ten (10) business days of the date upon which the new Deposit is determined, MBRK shall send to  DD the funds necessary to increase the Deposit.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties agree to meet via conference call within fifteen (15) business days of the end of each quarter to determine the necessary adjustment, if any, to the Deposit. If it is determined that the Deposit must be increased, within forty-five (45) business days of the date upon which the new Deposit is determined, MBRK shall send to DD the funds necessary to increase the Deposit.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract mandates a review and adjustment of the deposit amount within 5-10 business days, which aligns with standard business practice promoting timely financial oversight. The modified version extends this timeline to 15-45 business days which could potentially create inconsistency with standard accounting practices requiring more frequent reconciliation, thus creating potential financial discrepancies. This slower pace fails to meet the prudent financial management expectations, especially concerning deposit adjustments.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General accounting and financial management principles emphasizing timely reconciliation and adjustments of deposits.

perturbation.original_text: The Promotion Fees shall be paid to DD by MBRK fifteen (15) days after the receipt of an invoice from DD by  MBRK.
perturbation.changed_text: The Promotion Fees shall be paid to DD by MBRK ninety (90) days after the receipt of an invoice from DD by MBRK.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract mandates payment of promotion fees within 15 days, which is a standard payment term. The modified version extends this to 90 days, which may conflict with state prompt payment laws for services rendered.  Many states have laws requiring faster payment timelines, especially for small businesses or specific industries.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Prompt Payment Laws (e.g., laws regulating payment timelines for services rendered to businesses).

perturbation.original_text: All records maintained by DD pertaining to DD's services to MBRK pursuant to this Agreement shall be provided to  MBRK within 48 hours of MBRK's request. DD shall also make its records and other documents relevant to MBRK and  this Agreement available for audit or review by MBRK upon MBRK's request at a mutually agreed upon time.
perturbation.changed_text: All records maintained by DD pertaining to DD's services to MBRK pursuant to this Agreement shall be provided to MBRK within 30 days of MBRK's request. DD shall also make its records and other documents relevant to MBRK and this Agreement available for audit or review by MBRK upon MBRK's request after DD's legal counsel approves the documents to be released to MBRK.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires DD to provide records within 48 hours. The modified clause extends this to 30 days and adds a condition that DD's legal counsel must approve document release. This introduces potential delays and hinders MBRK's access to necessary documentation for compliance or dispute resolution purposes, potentially violating regulatory or contractual obligations requiring timely information access.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of good faith and fair dealing; potential conflicts with regulations requiring timely access to records.
